sec.p:
Recent work shows a large inter-model spread in cloud feedbacks
3 . These feedbacks are poorly constrained by traditional satellite records because they do not provide robust and stable measurements of the cloud vertical profile independently, of the surface and independently, of the cloud opacity. As shown herein, active remote sensor records like the lidar on board CALIPSO or the lidar and radar on board the future Earth Clouds, Aerosol and Radiation Explorer (EarthCARE)
44 satellite are powerful new tools to constrain the cloud feedback
45, 46 and, ultimately, reduce uncertainties on climate sensitivity estimates.
